intro: Crotalaria becquetii subsp. becquetii, commonly known as the African heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, and it is known for its ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions.
